creator: wsmwk

content: In your Thunderbird go to menu Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Show in Finder, then quit TB. In the TB profile folder (probably named somewhat like abcd1234.default-release) go to folder "Mail" and open it. You should see a sub-folder "Local Folders". Make a screen shot of the contents of Local Folders.
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Bug, unlikely.

You changed it back, and it stuck?
creator: wsmwk

content: HTML messages have start and stop tags for beginning and ending various styles, such as font, bold, italics. if you paste text in that has its own HTML tags, those may overlay existing tags and following text may appear with the style settings of the posted text. To avoid that, use the paste without formatting option.
creator: davidsk

content:
It seems that in order to create task, at least one active, writable calendar must exist.

Maybe you can enable one calendar and make it writable (i.e. not read-only) and then create task?

content:
Hello there We have read the question We try to help today

Yes Thunderbird is possible to use on certain platforms like Mac ,Windows and mobile window phones , Linux phones or other , the use of Thunderbird on iPhones iOS devices from a certain App Store ain't possible yet or is still not.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Googlethunderbird said
Yes Thunderbird is possible to use on certain platforms like Mac ,Windows and mobile window phones , Linux phones or other , the use of Thunderbird on iPhones iOS devices from a certain App Store ain't possible yet or is still not.

Not sure if it is a language issue but Thunderbird is only available for desktop Windows, macOS, Linux and as a mobile version for Android.

They are looking for developers to work on iOS/iPadOS version as per https://blog.thunderbird.net/2025/01/video-the-thunderbird-mobile-team/
creator: James
